alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 4:27PM MDT until June 01 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Phillips. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways possible in localized thunderstorm. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM MDT, Officials from the CMR National Wildlife Refuge reported that Rock Creek Road is closed due to a wash out from recent heavy rainfall and associated flooding. - 11 Miles east of Highway 191 on Rock Creek Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Phillips County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
